name: NGEE ANN PRIMARY SCHOOL
bus: 13 , 16 , 31 , 36 , 55 , 608 , 197 , 196 , 135 (at Marine Parade road) 13 , 16 and 196 (at Marine Terrace)

GeneralInformation.School Mission: To Nurture Every Child To His Best
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: The holistic education offered at Ngee Ann Primary School (NAPS) is built upon the strong foundation laid down by the founding fathers of the Ngee Ann Kongsi. In keeping with their aim of nurturing resilient children, the school's mission has been to nurture every child to his best.  Every student will go through the NAPS holistic education experience which provides development in the student's cognitive, moral, social, physical and aesthetics potential. A wide range of programmes and activities are implemented for the students to learn and develop in the different areas as well as to meet their different learning needs, interests and strengths. Values driven education is emphasized through the school's total curriculum.  In addition, structures and processes are put in place to enhance the element of care so as to take better care of each child's well-being.    The school continuously strengthens its Student centric, Values driven Education approaches to grow students' core competencies for them to thrive in the 21st century.  At the same time, the school will continue to develop the teachers for professional excellence as well as to engage the school's stakeholders in order to nurture every child to his best and to strive toward the school's vision of an excellent school and a caring community.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT-AIDED SCH / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.Music & Performing Arts: GRACE (Graciousness through Arts, Creating Excellence) in Performing Arts Programme

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: Learning for Life Programme (LLP) - NAPS' LLP is the school's signature  Performing Arts programme. It constitutes the Music Instructional Programme, Music Appreciation, Programme for Active Learning, Ngee Ann Modular Enrichment and Performing Arts CCA. Our LLP aims to provide all students a structured performing arts programme in a vibrant and conducive environment. Additional learning platforms are provided for talented students to excel. The LLP not only develops in students an appreciation for the arts, it also lays a strong foundation for character development and skills essential for lifelong learning.  Project Hope - Aligned with the school's strategic objective to develop students with moral values and social and community spirit, NAPS' structured Values-in-Action (VIA) programmes nurture the students to be active contributors to society.  The VIA platforms provide authentic learning opportunities for students to internalise and develop the school core values of Commitment, Resilience, Respect and Integrity. Project Hope is the school's key VIA.  The graduating cohort spearheads Project Hope, a home-school-community-wide collaboration that assists less privileged families living in the Marine Terrace vicinity.  Through this endeavour, the school aims to develop compassion in students and provide them an opportunity to put into action all the values they have learnt during their six years in NAPS.
